learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate and apply principles of drug delivery to hypothesise, propose and justify optimum solutions in developing new formulation
Integrate and apply Good Laboratory Practices (GLP) to range of formulation concepts in groups
Integrate evidence from variety of sources and hypothesise a potential solution using the pharmaceutical sciences to solve a clinical problem
Create and evaluate a pharmaceutical product using range of appropriate formulation and analytical methods with a view to optimise the properties of the product
Justify the formulation design based on literature and experimental data via written and oral modes of communication

assessments.task_description:
The online open-book quiz will assess your learning in week 1 and 2.

  • The quiz will be available for a 10-day period and can be taken at any time during that window.
  • The quiz duration is approximately 30 minutes.
  • The format may be a mixture of question types, for example, multiple choice, multiple answer, matching, ordering, fill in the blank/s, jumbled sentence/s, either/or (e.g., true/false), short answer, and short essay style questions.
  • Questions may be provided randomly from a pool, therefore each student may receive a different but equivalent quiz.
  • This is an online open book quiz undertaken in the venue of your choice.
  • You are required to undertake the quiz without any form of communication with other students.

assessments.assessment_title: Product creation - 3D printed tablet, suspension or capsule
assessments.due_date:
22/09/2025 - 13/10/2025

Submit your final product by the Friday of the third week of your scheduled 3-week practical block. Ideally end of your last practical.
assessments.task_description:
Working in a team, you will be assigned to formulate and prepare one of the following three dosage forms for a medication: 3D-printed tablets, a suspension, or a capsule formulation. Your team will then conduct pharmaceutical assays as applicable to the dosage form (e.g. uniformity of weight, disintegration, dissolution, viscosity).

See the course Learn.UQ (Blackboard) site for more details and the marking criteria.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit the final formulation with compounding worksheet and compounding label. Based on the scenario and research outcome there may be more than one product and respective label/compounding worksheet per group.

assessments.task_description:
Record a video report with your team in which you describe the methods that you used and the prototype that you created. This is a group assessment item.

  • The video report will be in the form of a pre-recorded video presentation using PowerPoint slides (or equivalent). Submit both the video and a pdf of the slides.
  • All members of the team must contribute to the preparation of the slides and filming of the video.
  • Your camera must be turned on and your face visible during the entire presentation video. Any parts of the presentation that do not comply with this requirement will receive a mark of zero.
  • All members of the team who contributed and are visible in the presentation will receive the same mark for this assessment.
  • See the course Learn.UQ (Blackboard) site for more details and the marking criteria.
  • This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex.
